span.p: In addition to the community information below, Kyrene employees can find further resources onWorkplace.

a.strong: A Message from Dr. Vesely to Team Kyrene

strong.a: March 2020 Employee Wellness News (with information specific to COVID-19)

p.strong: New State of Arizona Information Hotline: 2-1-1
p.br:
There is a new statewide hotline that residents can call with questions related to COVID-19. It is available in both English and Spanish, and can be reached by dialing 2-1-1 from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.
The hotline will provide information on:

ul.li: how to prepare for and prevent the spread of COVID-19;
testing for COVID-19 as it becomes available;
who is at a higher risk of contracting COVID-19;
what to do if you get sick; and
where to find the most up-to-date and accurate information (e.g., the CDC).

div.h1: About Benefits, Pay and Paid Time Off

h1.aria-label: What should I do if I have been tested for or diagnosed with COVID-19?
h1.span: What should I do if I have been tested for or diagnosed with COVID-19?

div.p: Maricopa County along with OSHA has provided the following guidelines for employees:

ul.li: If you have tested positive for COVID-19 and you have been in a Kyrene School District school building or on-site work location within the past 14 days, please contact district Lead Nurse Renee Dull, rdull@kyrene.org and Chief Benefits Officer Deb Spurgin, dspurgin@kyrene.org

If you test positive for COVID-19, stay home and observe isolation protocols for at least seven days from the time you were tested or 72 hours (3 full days) after symptoms resolve, whichever time period is longer.
If you have been tested for COVID-19 and are awaiting test results, stay home and observe isolation protocols until you receive results.

If you experience the primary symptoms of COVID-19 (fever, cough, shortness of breath), or if you experience a fever combined with gastrointestinal symptoms, stay home until you have been symptom free for 72 hours (3 full days). This applies even if you have tested negative for COVID-19 or if you have not been tested at all.
If you are sick with symptoms other than those associated with COVID-19, stay home until you have been symptom free for 24 hours (1 full day).

p.span: If you are instructed by your healthcare provider or public health officials to notify your employer, please contact the district Lead Nurse, Renee Dull,
and Chief Benefits Officer, Deb Spurgin,

h1.aria-label: Are there wellness resources for employees and families covered on Kyrene medical plans?
h1.span: Are there wellness resources for employees and families covered on Kyrene medical plans?

p.span: You may call UHC Customer Service and ask to speak to a nurse who can assist you with best next steps and to find an in-network provider, 1-866-314-0335. Have your medical ID card handy when you make the call.

div.p: Telehealth and virtual visits are also encouraged for UHC plan participants. For those with an iPhone, these visits work like a FaceTime call. UHC plan participants should visit www.myuhc.com or go to the App store to download, Teledoc, Amwell, or Doctor on Demand. Once on the service, you are matched with a doctor for the condition you are calling in about. These doctors can diagnose and prescribe medications, if needed. Wait times in the virtual waiting room are longer than usual, but this is still the preferred method over walking in to an urgent care or doctors office to limit the spread of COVID-19.

p.span: UHC has provided a free service for emotional support and anxiety. The Emotional Support Help Line is 1-866-342-6892

h1.aria-label: What if I am sick or have circumstances that make me unable to work during school closures?
h1.span: What if I am sick or have circumstances that make me unable to work during school closures?

div.p: Please contact your Principal or Supervisor to discuss your situation and work options. You may be eligible to request a leave of absence. To request a leave of absence contact HR Specialist Jennie Truman, jtruman@kyrene.org

Any employee on a Kyrene medical insurance plan in need of a healthcare provider can visitwww.myuhc.comor call UHC Customer Service, 1-866-314-0335. You can also call anytime to speak to a nurse. Additionally, there is an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for additional support during this crisis.View flyer.

h1.aria-label: What is the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) and how does it affect me?
h1.span: What is the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) and how does it affect me?

div.p: The Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) requires certain employers to provide their employees with paid sick leave and expanded family and medical leave for specified reasons related to COVID-19. These provisions will apply from April 1, 2020 through December 31, 2020.

p.span: You may find information about FFCRA on the
and on the

h1.aria-label: The Governing Board resolution ensures continued pay for Kyrene employees. What does that mean?
h1.span: The Governing Board resolution ensures continued pay for Kyrene employees. What does that mean?

p.span: Employees with fixed-term contracts (e.g. teachers, allied health, support exempt, and administrators) will receive their base salary, plus any applicable market stipends. Hourly staff will log hours using Time Clock Plus (TCP), even if working remotely. Staff working remotely will work regularly scheduled hours and days, based upon position.

h1.aria-label: Will my employee benefits end during the closure?
h1.span: Will my employee benefits end during the closure?

p.span: For most staff, since working and/or on call status is available and the staff member is being paid, employee benefits will have no disruption.

h1.aria-label: What Cigna dental services are available to me virtually?
h1.span: What Cigna dental services are available to me virtually?

div.p:
To assist your employees during the COVID-19 pandemic and quarantine period, weve launched Cigna Dental Virtual Care, powered by The TeleDentists.
This service allows customers to speak with a licensed dentist by video chat which eliminates the need to leave home and visit a dental office. Through May 31, 2020, Cigna Dental customers can use this virtual care option at no cost for dental consultations.

h1.aria-label: What options are there for filling prescriptions?
h1.span: What options are there for filling prescriptions?

p.span: UHC plan members may be able to get an early refill on routine medications, if needed. Please call your local established pharmacy, or log in to
, if you have mail order prescriptions through OptumRx.

h1.aria-label: How are elective surgeries being affected?
h1.span: How are elective surgeries being affected?

p.span: Elective surgeries are being delayed as is now being required nationwide. Approved pre-authorizations for any delayed elective surgery will be honored by UHC and approval is currently extended an additional 90 days. Please call your healthcare provider to determine if a surgical delay will apply for you.

h1.aria-label: Can I get a loan or request a hardship withdrawal from my optional retirement savings 403b account?
h1.span: Can I get a loan or request a hardship withdrawal from my optional retirement savings 403b account?

div.p: The coronavirus-relief bill known as the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (CARES Act) was signed into law on March 27, 2020. The CARES Act allows 403b optional retirement plan participants greater access to their 403b investments if they are facing a financial hardship. Participant questions regarding hardship withdrawals and loans can be directed to AIG representative, Shane Russell. Shane.Russell@aig.com

h1.aria-label: Who is currently able to enter our schools?
h1.span: Who is currently able to enter our schools?

p.span: For the safety and health of our employees, schools were closed to staff after March 20, so that areas could be sanitized and sealed to ensure they remain disinfected throughout school closures.
p.b: If site staff need to get back into a site, they should contact a supervisor.

h1.aria-label: When will students and staff be able to collect non-essential personal items from schools?
h1.span: When will students and staff be able to collect non-essential personal items from schools?

div.p: Depending on the development of the COVID-19 pandemic, Kyrene School District is exploring options for an organized pickup of non-essential personal items at the end of the year.

h1.aria-label: How will students return library books, athletic uniforms, loaned devices, etc. after school closure?
h1.span: How will students return library books, athletic uniforms, loaned devices, etc. after school closure?

div.p: Depending on the development of the COVID-19 pandemic, Kyrene School District is exploring options for an organized return of borrowed items at the end of the year.

h1.aria-label: How does this affect teacher retirement dates/eligibility?
h1.span: How does this affect teacher retirement dates/eligibility?

p.span: Currently
the closure would not affect the teacher/staff retirement date/eligibility since they are technically still working or on call during their normal contracted days.

h1.aria-label: Kyrene is still hiring. If a new person is hired, when will that new employee begin work?
h1.span: Kyrene is still hiring. If a new person is hired, when will that new employee begin work?

p.span: Although Human Resource Services will continue to process employees for 2019-20 vacancies, employees may not begin work right away.

h1.aria-label: What are the options for telecommuting?
h1.span: What are the options for telecommuting?

p.span: Kyrene is currently working on identifying employee groups where telecommuting options are available. Employees should work directly with your supervisor for opportunities.

h1.aria-label: How does Kyrene define working from home?
h1.span: How does Kyrene define working from home?

div.p: Administrators are on call, per policy. All employees should be available by phone and checking email during assigned hours. Follow regular leave policies if sick or otherwise unavailable to work from home. Supervisors will work directly with any employees required to report for critical on-site work.

h1.aria-label: Do I need to clock out for lunch if I am working from home?
h1.span: Do I need to clock out for lunch if I am working from home?

p.span: Yes, if you are an employee who works at least six hour a day must still clock in and out for lunch daily. This is a federal requirement to ensure that the District provides a lunch break.

h1.aria-label: What are some professional development opportunities I can do from home?
h1.span: What are some professional development opportunities I can do from home?

p.span: Arizona State University has compiled a large amount of community resources, including remote options for professional development for educators:

h1.aria-label: When do the four-day work weeks begin and end?
h1.span: When do the four-day work weeks begin and end?

p.span: The 4-day work week begins on Monday, March 30 and will continue for the duration of school closures.

h1.aria-label: Which days of the week make up the four-day week?
h1.span: Which days of the week make up the four-day week?

p.span: The District has determined that the district schools and District Office will be closed on Fridays. Employees should work their four day work week hours from Monday through Thursday.

h1.aria-label: How do I enter time off during a four-day week?
h1.span: How do I enter time off during a four-day week?

p.span: Each employee will enter their time off request in the same way that you would normally do.

li.span: : Enter your time off through Absence Management. Select No Sub Required and change the default time off request to 10 hours for a full day.

: Enter your time off through iVisions. Enter one fourth (25%) of your weekly hours as the daily amount of time off. For example, a 40 hour a week employee would enter 10 hours for their time off request. For an employee who normally works 32 hours a week, the employee would enter 8 hours for their time off request.

: Enter your time off through TCP. Enter one fourth (25%) of your weekly hours as the daily amount of time off. For example, a 40 hour a week employee would enter 10 hours for their time off request. For an employee who normally works 32 hours a week, the employee would enter 8 hours for their time off request.

h1.aria-label: Does a four day work week change the number of hours I normally work in a week?
h1.span: Does a four day work week change the number of hours I normally work in a week?

div.p: No, employees will continue to work the same number of hours during a four day work week that you would during a five day work week.

h1.aria-label: I am an ESP employee. What if I do not work all of my hours for the week?
h1.span: I am an ESP employee. What if I do not work all of my hours for the week?

div.p: Employees should review their hours in TCP to determine if they have either worked or requested time off. If you did not work all of your hours for the week, you can enter a time off request into TCP by Sunday for the previous week to ensure that your hours for the week are correct. You may use any leave balance available to you to request time off during the school closure.

h1.aria-label: I am an ESP employee. How do I meet my weekly hours during a 4-day work week?
h1.span: I am an ESP employee. How do I meet my weekly hours during a 4-day work week?

div.p: The same number of work hours would now be spread over four days instead of five. For employees working a 40 hour week, that means working those 40 hours over four days. For employees who work less than 40 hours weekly, you should work those hours over four days. This may mean your daily hours worked may not be the same each day as long as you work all of your weekly hours over the four days.

h1.aria-label: I am an ESP employee who clocks in and out of TCP. Do I still need to use TCP during a four-day work week?
h1.span: I am an ESP employee who clocks in and out of TCP. Do I still need to use TCP during a four-day work week?

p.span: Yes. TCP is the system of record that is used to generate payroll. Even during times of school closure, a reliable and accountable timekeeping system is required to ensure employees are accurately paid. Even if you are working remotely, if you are an ESP employee who normally clocks in and out of TCP, you still need to enter your time in TCP by using either a site based TCP clock, from the TCP mobile app, or by using the TCP webclock. Any employee who would normally enter any absence/leave time through TCP should continue to enter that information into TCP as well, even if working remotely.
[LB1]

h1.aria-label: How do I sign in to Outlook Online (Webmail)?
h1.span: How do I sign in to Outlook Online (Webmail)?

div.p: Navigate to www.kyrene.org. Hover your cursor over the Employees channel in the orange ribbon at the top of the screen. Select Employee Email Access.

p.br: ClickLog into KSD Outlook.Enter your Kyrene email address and password.

img.alt: Image of Outlook Online link on www.kyrene.org website
img.title: Image of Outlook Online link on www.kyrene.org website

h1.aria-label: How do I see all new email messages and replies in Outlook Online (Webmail)? My email messages seem to be hidden.
h1.span: How do I see all new email messages and replies in Outlook Online (Webmail)? My email messages seem to be hidden.

div.p:
In Outlook Webmail, "Conversation View" groups email messages into conversations based on the subject of the message. Conversation View is enabled by default for every mail folder in your mailbox. Read or unread messages may end up buried under the conversation by new replies.
Example: If you receive an email as an individual or in a group, as people reply, it will show up in your email box as one message with an arrow next to it that would need to be clicked on in order to expand all messages in the conversation. This view can be changed to Individual Message View like it appears in standard Outlook for Desktop, by following instructions at the link below.
Outlook Online Webmail - Adjust Inbox Message Organization

h1.aria-label: How do I Block name/number on personal cell phones when making outgoing calls?
h1.span: How do I Block name/number on personal cell phones when making outgoing calls?

p.span: No problem - just dial *67 before the number you are calling and it will block your name/number from being shown to the party you are calling. (ex. Dial... *67-480-541-1000)

h1.aria-label: Im not sure Im getting all staff communications. What should I do?
h1.span: Im not sure Im getting all staff communications. What should I do?

p.span: If you are not receiving emails, please contact
to inform Communications & Marketing.

If you are not receiving phone calls, please verify that your personal contact information is correct in iVisions. Also note that phone calls from Kyrene School District may show up as spam on your incoming call. Be sure to listen to all voicemails, even if you do not pick up spam calls.
In order to receive text alerts from Kyrene District and schools, you must OPT IN. To do this, simply text Y or yes to 67587
Be sure to also inform your supervisor of any gaps in communication, in case they need to contact you by other means.

h1.aria-label: Who should I contact if I have questions not covered in these FAQs?
h1.span: Who should I contact if I have questions not covered in these FAQs?

p.span: Employees are asked to direct questions to your principal, director or immediate supervisor as much as possible. If they do not have an answer immediately available, they will share your questions with the Emergency Management Team for a response, follow up, or inclusion in the staff FAQs.
